passage.text: The DNA-repair protein AlkB, EGL-9, and leprecan define new families of 2-oxoglutarate- and iron-dependent dioxygenases

By means of sequence profile searches, we reveal that 2OG-Fe(II) oxygenase fold is present in multiple protein families that were previously unknown to us, enabling us to predict the catalytic activity of various biologically relevant proteins from eukaryotes and bacteria.
The RecQ family includes BLM, which is a rare autosomal recessive disorder that causes high levels of genomic instability, immunodeficiency, small stature, and frequent cell death.

Findings indicate that ethylene, which is produced by ethephon, was found to mediate intracellular calcium level ([Ca2+]i) in mouse NIH-3T3 and human HeLa and SaOS-2 cells. These findings provide support for previous findings of increased [Cava2 +]inhibition, as well as an increase in the expression of an enriched form-factor gene, SDERR, in invertebrate cells (primmorphs of the marine sponge S. domuncula).
